member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.CustomCalendarItem.BaseCalendarItem
member.summary:
Base CalendarItem
This property holds the base CalendarItem from which each displayed CustomItem (of this type) is based.
In order to keep all displayed items "in-sync", it is necessary to propagate data to and from the base CalendarItem. This is accomplished via hooking those members you are interested in, at both the item (HookEvents) and BaseCalendarItem (HookBaseEvents) level.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Schedule.Model.CalendarModel.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Suspends internal control updates to the cache structures etc. When making changes on multiple appointments time related properties or when adding multiple appointments before doing so call BeginUpdate and after updates are done call EndUpdate method to optimize performance. Calls to BeginUpdate method can be nested and only last outer most EndUpdate call will resume internal control updates.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Schedule.Model.MonthlyRecurrenceSettings.RepeatOnDayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the day of month on which appointment is repeated. When RepeatOnRelativeDayInMonth property is set to value other than None value of this property is not used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Schedule.Model.MonthlyRecurrenceSettings.RepeatOnRelativeDayInMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether appointment should repeat on first, second, third, fourth or last day in month as specified by RepeatOnDayOfMonth property. Property applies only for RecurrenceType Monthly or Yearly.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Schedule.Model.MonthlyRecurrenceSettings.RepeatInterval
member.summary:
Gets or sets the interval between recurring appointments. Default value is 1.
For example, setting RepeatInterval to 2 means that appointment will recur every 2 months.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Schedule.Model.MonthlyRecurrenceSettings.RelativeDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the day of week on which relative repeat as specified by RepeatOnRelativeDayInMonth is effective. For example setting RepeatOnRelativeDayInMonth to First and RelativeDayOfWeek to Monday will repeat the appointment on first Monday in a month.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Schedule.Model.MonthlyRecurrenceSettings.RepeatOnMonths
member.summary:
Gets or sets the months on which appointment is repeated. This property is represented by bit-flag enum which means that you can combine the values from eMonthRecurrence enum using OR operator to specify multiple values. Default value is All.
For example you could set this property to eMonthRecurrence.January | eMonthRecurrence.July to repeat appointments on January and July only.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether reminder will be active for appointments that are in the past. Default value is true. This property is useful if you are creating recurring appointments with reminders that start in past but don't want reminders for past instances of appointment to be active.

Gets or sets the days of week on which appointment is repeated. This property is represented by bit-flag enum which means that you can combine the values from eDayOfWeekRecurrence enum using OR operator to specify multiple values. Default value is All.
This property value cannot be set to eDayOfWeekRecurrence.None.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Schedule.Model.WeeklyRecurrenceSettings.RepeatInterval
member.summary:
Gets or sets the interval between recurring appointments. Default value is 1.
For example, setting RepeatInterval to 2 means that appointment will recur every 2 weeks.

member.summary: Occurs when property value has changed.

member.summary: Occurs when property or property of child objects has changed. This event is similar to PropertyChanged event with key difference that it occurs for the property changed of child objects as well.

member.summary: Gets or sets the day of week on which relative repeat as specified by RepeatOnRelativeDayInMonth is effective. For example setting RepeatOnRelativeDayInMonth to First and RelativeDayOfWeek to Monday will repeat the appointment on first Monday in a month.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.GetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WINDOWPLACEMENT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the show state and the restored, minimized, and maximized positions of the specified window.
member.param:
A pointer to the WINDOWPLACEMENT structure that receives the show state and position information.
Before calling GetWindowPlacement, set the length member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT). GetWindowPlacement fails if lpwndpl-> length is not set correctly.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions
member.summary: Options available when a form is tested for mose positions.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.Error
member.summary: HTERROR: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows (same as HTNOWHERE, except that the DefWindowProc function produces a system beep to indicate an error).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TransparentOrCovered
member.summary: HTTRANSPARENT: In a window currently covered by another window in the same thread (the message will be sent to underlying windows in the same thread until one of them returns a code that is not HTTRANSPARENT).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.NoWhere
member.summary: HTNOWHERE: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.SystemMenu
member.summary: HTSYSMENU: In a window menu or in a Close button in a child window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.GrowBox
member.summary: HTGROWBOX: In a size box (same as HTSIZE).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.HorizontalScrollBar
member.summary: HTHSCROLL: In a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.VerticalScrollBar
member.summary: HTVSCROLL: In the vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.LeftSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTLEFT: In the left border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.RightSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTRIGHT: In the right border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTTOP: In the upper-horizontal border of a window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopLeftSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTTOPLEFT: In the upper-left corner of a window border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopRightSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTTOPRIGHT: In the upper-right corner of a window border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTBOTTOM: In the lower-horizontal border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window vertically).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomLeftSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTBOTTOMLEFT: In the lower-left corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomRightSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTBOTTOMRIGHT: In the lower-right corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.NonSizableBorder
member.summary: HTBORDER: In the border of a window that does not have a sizing border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.SizeBox
member.summary: HTSIZE: In a size box (same as HTGROWBOX). (Same as GrowBox).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.ReduceButton
member.summary: HTREDUCE: In a Minimize button. (Same as MinimizeButton).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.ZoomButton
member.summary: HTZOOM: In a Maximize button. (Same as MaximizeButton).

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Normal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_* value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Schedule.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.
